meanings.definition: Drive (a vehicle) in a reckless or dangerous manner.
meanings.sent1: He was misdriving on the icy road, putting himself and others at risk.
meanings.sent2: The teenager was caught misdriving in the neighborhood, breaking the speed limit.
meanings.sent3: The misdriving squirrel darted across the street, narrowly avoiding a collision.
meanings.sent4: Her emotions were misdriving her actions, leading to impulsive decisions.
meanings.sent5: The storm was misdriving the waves, creating chaos in the ocean.

meanings.definition: Cause (someone) to drive in a reckless or dangerous manner.
meanings.sent1: The loud music misdriving the driver's focus, making him swerve on the road.
meanings.sent2: Peer pressure can misdrive inexperienced drivers into risky behaviors.
meanings.sent3: The misdriving friend convinced him to speed, resulting in a ticket.
meanings.sent4: Fear can misdrive even the most cautious drivers to make mistakes.
meanings.sent5: The misleading signs misdrove the tourists into a dead-end street.
